qas.question: In 2010, what was conducted on mummified remains of baboons?
What type of analysis did the scientists use to examine hairs from the 2 baboon mummies formerly preserved in the British Museum?
Who was determined to be the closest match for the baboon mummies?

answers.text: modern baboon specimens in Eritrea and Ethiopia

qas.question: Where did the 2 baboons' mummified remains originate?
Where did researchers suggest that Punt was located?

answers.text: region that included eastern Ethiopia and all of Eritrea

qas.question: How many mummified baboons did Punt gift to the ancient Egyptians?
In what year were the mummified baboons transferred from Egypt to the British Museum?
How many mummified baboons does the Egyptian Museum now have on display?
Scientists compared the DNA of the baboon with distorted isotopic data to what?
How many hairs on each baboon mummy did scientists study?

context: In <b6_0>2010<b6_0/>, a <a0_0>genetic<a0_0/> study was conducted on the mummified remains of baboons that were brought back as gifts from <a3_0>Punt<a3_0/> by the ancient Egyptians. Led by a research team from the Egyptian Museum and the University of California, the scientists used <a1_0>oxygen isotope analysis<a1_0/> to examine hairs from <b5_0><b7_0>two<b7_0/><b5_0/> baboon mummies that had been preserved in the British Museum. <b9_0>One<b9_0/> of the baboons had distorted isotopic data, so the other's oxygen isotope values were compared to those of <b8_0>present-day baboon specimens<b8_0/> from regions of interest. The researchers found that the mummies most closely matched <a2_0>modern baboon specimens in Eritrea and Ethiopia<a2_0/>, which they suggested implied that Punt was likely a narrow <a4_0>region that included eastern Ethiopia and all of Eritrea<a4_0/>.
